Sentencas: The hybridization of Solid Oxide Fuel Cell (SOFC) and gas turbine technologies provides an increase in system efficiency and economic performance.
Titulo: Operating strategies to minimize degradation in fuel cell gas turbine hybrids

Sentencas: The latter aspect is significantly affected by fuel cell degradation, due to several mechanisms.
Titulo: Operating strategies to minimize degradation in fuel cell gas turbine hybrids

Sentencas: However, hybrid systems allow different control strategies to minimize degradation effects on system performance and their impact on economic feasibility.
Titulo: Operating strategies to minimize degradation in fuel cell gas turbine hybrids

Sentencas: A real-time distributed model of a SOFC was used to simulate fuel tell degradation in the cases of a standalone stack and a hybrid configuration, in the latter of which the numerical model is normally coupled with the hybrid system hardware components of the National Energy Technology Laboratory (NETL) hyper facility.
Titulo: Operating strategies to minimize degradation in fuel cell gas turbine hybrids

Sentencas: The results showed how in a hybrid system it is possible, with an appropriate strategy, to maintain constant voltage even if the cell is degrading, reducing degradation rate during time.
Titulo: Operating strategies to minimize degradation in fuel cell gas turbine hybrids

Sentencas: At constant power demand, fuel cell life could be significantly extended using the operating strategies allowed by coupling with a turbine (an order of magnitude longer than a standalone fuel cell), maintaining high system efficiency despite fuel cell degradation.
Titulo: Operating strategies to minimize degradation in fuel cell gas turbine hybrids
